alert.note: Alert for Central Beaufort Sea Coast (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 11 at 5:03PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM AKDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring. * WHERE...Sagavanirktok and Kuparuk Rivers near Deadhorse. * WHEN...Until 600 AM AKDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying areas along the Kuparuk and Sagavanirktok Rivers. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 500 PM AKDT, between 2 and 3 inches of rain fell Friday night and Saturday in the Northeast Brooks Range and caused minor flooding along the Sagavanirktok and Kuparuk Rivers. The Kuparuk River crested at 36.0 feet Monday night which is 6 inches above flood stage. Water levels on the Kuparuk and Sagavanirktok Rivers will continue to slowly fall into Wednesday. - Another significant rain event is expected tonight and Wednesday in the headwaters. This will likely cause the Sagavanirktok and Kuparuk Rivers to rise to near bankfull Thursday and Friday, but additional flooding is not expected. - www.weather.gov/aprfc - If you are along the Sagavanirktok or Kuparuk River be prepared for minor flooding today.
